column1: On [[8 November]] [[1959]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"
column2: a letter]] to [[Naomi Mitchison]]'''.<ref>[[Wayne G. Hammond]] (1993), ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien: A Descriptive Bibliography]]'', p. 360</ref><ref name=TB1>{{webcite

column1: *'''Subject:''' Tolkien notes that much of the early part of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' was written in [[Wikipedia:Sidmouth
column2: Sidmouth]].<ref name=TB1/> He regrets not being able to meet Mitchison.<ref name=TB2/>

column1: *'''Publication:''' Extracts from the letter appeared in ''Biblioasis One, or The Quencher'' (Melissa and Mark Hime, 1980), and was described<!-- and quoted from??? --> in ''[[Sotheby's Valuable Autograph Letters, Literary Manuscripts and Historical Documents 12-13 December 1977]]''.
